reviews.sentence: Never again. I asked for a king bed when I registered for the room but when I got there I was told they did not have anymore. So I was given a double room which was full of mold. A c consistently made noise to the point you were not able to sleep. The bath tub had something which look like paint all in the bottom and rust was in the tub. The toilet seat was very old and worn down. A horrible room which made my stay horrible.

Very good. The bed and pillows were comfortable and clean. The breakfast area was clean and hosted a good assortment to accommodate each persons taste. All the staff were very friendly and attentive to the needs of the guests. The Inn seemed to need a little update to the room. The shower curtain was not secured to the wall correctly and the carpet seems rather used.

Very good. The bed and pillows were comfortable and clean. The breakfast area was clean and hosted a good assortment to accommodate each persons taste. All the staff were very friendly and attentive to the needs of the guests. The Inn seemed to need a little update to the room. The shower curtain was not secured to the wall correctly and the carpet seems rather used.
Staff not very helpful but rooms and pool are very nice. great hot breakfast. eggs bacon hashbrowns the works.
Great for a brief stay. Bed was comfy. The bathroom lights were on some kind of timer and went off at the most inopportune times. Hard to get them back on.
Acomadating and friendly staff. The first room top floor had been smoked in very recently. My husband and I used to be smokers. NOT GOOD. Went to front desk they quickly changed our room.

Great deal and location. Comfy pillows. Spacious clean bathroom. Hairdryer died after 2 minutes. Had to go to the front desk for a key to the room next to mine to use the hairdryer in there. Always bring your own.

Room 324. suite needs some work. Toilet leaked water all over the floor constantly. We went through 4 towels keeping it out of our way. Hotel was fully booked and we did n’t bother with complaints. Our tub was roughly patched from where we are assuming it broke or cracked. Stayed 3 nights was a hassle adding the 3rd night on was no option for a later checkout so ended up just paying for an entire extra night just so we did n’t have to leave quite so early. We ’re from out of town. Top crack in the top part of our wall on the window side had mold growing. Our room got skipped over for cleaning during the extended stay extra night fiasco and had to run down fresh towels ourselves. Felt like a huge waste for 300.

Stayed here in the suit on the top floor. I did not realize the clock in the room was 30 minutes behind. So when I went to grab breakfast I was disappointed to find it closed and cleaned up. The lady behind the bar would not budge on letting me get any food as it was my fault the hotels clock was not set correctly. The room next to mine had a party all night and the wall was constantly being hit or bashed while the stench of weed seeped in giving me the worst head ache. After taking a bath I had to manually hold the valve open to drain the tub. If not it would just reshut and I had just have a tub of stagnant soapy water. Not a fan. The room had a mirror door to a storage area the door was off the track. After opening it it would not close again. The floor had holes and gaps in it where the fake wood tiles did not close. In hind sight the room seemed like a half finished rushed construction job. Never staying here again.

Typical experience sad to say. The door would n’t lock. Since I had a 70 bike in the room I hesitated to leave. The couple next door had an orgasmic time well experienced through the walls. The maids played music loud enough to wake me the next morning. By 830 most of the food was gone. Not the best stay you might say. But I ca n’t blame anyone for all that. This has become a typical experience nowadays. Sad to say.

Exceptional. The staff was great. Bokingcom advertised that they had a queen suite with a jacuzi tub. That was the room I booked. The staff informed me they no longer have these rooms available. She gave us a really nice room but I would not have paid the extra money for a suite I did not need. I could have gotten a regular room for about 250 cheaper a night.
Nice rooms and free breakfast.
Great room but pass on the breakfast. Nice hotel for the price. Breakfast was severely lacking. cold stale and coffee as see through as water.

Over all it was a very good stay in SC. The staff and my room was wonderful. The location was ideal. I had to run the shower for a good 15 minutes before I got hot water and even then it was lukewarm for a while. The toilet was running because the plunger would not drop.
Exceptional. Attendant courteous and helpful. Room clean and comfy. Breakfast good. Rate was excellent. N A.
Quiet room and great breakfast.

Will stay here EVERY time I am in Greenville. The location is perfect. Besides being in a safe and secure neighborhood it is surrounded by every retail shop you might want to visit including Costco and Sams for gas and a variety of chain and independent restaurants. Also the room and entire facilities are very clean and comfortable. I have no complaints.

Wonderful. Easy to find and located close to everything you need. The front desk receptionist was awesome and the room was very clean. I liked the layout of the room and the shower and soaps were on point. The bed was comfy at first but throughout the night not so much. In all honesty it was the best hotel bed I ever slept in. What I really did nt like was the breakfast. The eggs were mushy and the sausage was not cooked all the way and the biscuits were dry. I just really was not happy with it.
Very clean and newly renovated. All staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. Great breakfast plenty of options and restocked when it got low.
Wonderful. Great room and breakfast. I will definitely stay here again if I travel to that area in the future.
